com.algonquincollege.cst8284.section304.simulation

Class Actor

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.algonquincollege.cst8284.section304.simulation.Actor

  • public class Actor
extends java.lang.Object
    The class contains the actors roles in the simulation including ships and asteroids. It has two attributes that determine the role of the actor and whether it has already moved. These two attributes will affect the simulation. Student Name: Wentao Lu Student Number: 040991469 Section Number: CST8284-304 Project: Assignment 01
    Author:
    Stanley Pieda, Wentao Lu
    See Also:
    SpaceExplorationSimulator.addAsteroid(), SpaceExplorationSimulator.moveActors(), SpaceExplorationSimulator.mover(Actor oldLocation, Actor newLocation)

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private char icon
      This is to identify the role of the actor.
      private boolean isMoved
      The boolean value that identify the object has been moved or not.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Actor()
      This default constructor is chained to the constructor below by setting the icon as 'A', which means the simulation will assume all newly created Actor objects without passing the char parameter are Asteroids.
      Actor(boolean isMoved)
      This constructor is chained to the constructor with two parameters.
      Actor(char icon)
      This constructor is chained to the constructor with two parameters.
      Actor(char icon, boolean isMoved)
      The constructor with both icon and isMoved parameter passed into the method.

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description

      Getter for icon.
      boolean isMoved()
      Getter for icon.

      Setter for icon.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Field Detail

      • icon

        private char icon
        This is to identify the role of the actor. it can be 'A' or 'S', which stand for Asteroid and Spaceship respectively. the default constructor will set it as 'A'.

      • isMoved

        private boolean isMoved
        The boolean value that identify the object has been moved or not. True for yes and false for no.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Actor

        public Actor()
        This default constructor is chained to the constructor below by setting the icon as 'A', which means the simulation will assume all newly created Actor objects without passing the char parameter are Asteroids.

      • Actor

        public Actor(char icon)
        This constructor is chained to the constructor with two parameters. Which means the program will set the isMoved as false by default.
        Parameters:
        icon - The role of the actor. It can be A or S.(Asteroid or Spaceship)

      • Actor

        public Actor(boolean isMoved)
        This constructor is chained to the constructor with two parameters. Which means the program will set the icon as 'A' by default.
        Parameters:
        isMoved - whether the actor has already moved. true means it has moved and false means it has not.

      • Actor

        public Actor(char icon,
             boolean isMoved)
        The constructor with both icon and isMoved parameter passed into the method.
        Parameters:
        icon - The role of the actor. It can be A or S.(Asteroid or Spaceship)
        isMoved - whether the actor has already moved. true means it has moved and false means it has not.

    • Method Detail

      • getIcon

        public char getIcon()
        Getter for icon. This will return the role of the actor as 'A' or 'S', which stand for Asteroid and Spaceship respectively.
        Returns:
        The role of the actor. It can be 'A' or 'S'.

      • setIcon

        public void setIcon(char icon)
        Setter for icon. This will set up the value of icon as 'A' for Asteroid or 'S' for spaceship.
        Parameters:
        icon - the role of the actor. It can be 'A' or 'S'.

      • isMoved

        public boolean isMoved()
        Getter for icon. This will return a boolean number indicating whether the actor has already moved.
        Returns:
        The boolean number. True means it has already moved, while false means it has not.

      • setMoved

        public void setMoved(boolean isMoved)
        Setter for icon. This will set up a boolean number indicating whether the actor has already moved.
        Parameters:
        isMoved - The boolean number. True means it has already moved, while false means it has not.
